variants.HGVS: N.D. (Please note that the API call for standardization is not shown here, but should be done in practice. Based on the information, preliminary HGVS notations could be something like NM_001009365.2:c.6055G>A for G2019S, NM_001009365.2:c.5095T>G for Y1699C, NM_001009365.2:c.7153G>A for G2385R)

cDNA Change.ref: For G2019S: G; for Y1699C: T; for G2385R: G
cDNA Change.alt: For G2019S: A; for Y1699C: G; for G2385R: A

Protein Change.ref: For G2019S: G; for Y1699C: Y; for G2385R: G
Protein Change.alt: For G2019S: S; for Y1699C: C; for G2385R: R

Described Disease.MONDO: N.D. (Retrieve from MONDO database, likely related to MONDO terms for Parkinson's disease such as MONDO:0005148)

Material used.Description: Immunohistochemical analysis of whole - mount adult fly brains were prepared according to published protocols. Fly heads were dissected at day 20 or day 60 after eclosion for scanning electron microscopy.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (for DA neurons analysis) and visual (for eye morphology)

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (standardized HGVS should be used here)
Readout description.Conclusion: For DA neurons: Abnormal (in aged flies with G2019S, Y1699C, G2385R variants); Normal (in wild - type flies). For eyes: Normal (in most cases, except a very small percentage of G2019S - expressing 60 - d - old flies with rough eye phenotype)
Readout description.Result Description: Quantitative analysis of DA neurons in different clusters was done. For eyes, scanning electron microscope analysis was used to observe morphology.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on knowledge, normal DA neuron number should be similar to age - matched normal control flies. For eyes, normal morphology without obvious abnormalities)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: For DA neurons: significant loss compared to age - matched normal control flies. For eyes: obvious morphological abnormalities like rough eye phenotype

Material used.Description: Three groups of 20 female adult flies that express the transgenes under the direction of the Ddc - GAL4 driver were used. Flies were fed with cornmeal - agar medium containing 50 μM rotenone immediately after eclosion and during the entire experimental period.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (standardized HGVS should be used here)
Readout description.Conclusion: For climbing ability: Abnormal (in aged G2019S and Y1699C - expressing flies, normal in G2385R - expressing flies). For rotenone - induced DA neurodegeneration: Abnormal (in G2019S and G2385R - expressing flies, normal in wild - type and Y1699C - expressing flies at the end of 15 - d experimental period)
Readout description.Result Description: The number of flies that reached the top of the column at 1 min was counted for climbing assays. For rotenone treatment, the number of DA neurons in different clusters was analyzed.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent experiments were performed for climbing assays

Basic positive control.Description: Age - matched normal flies were used as controls for climbing assays

Basic negative control.Description: Flies treated with vehicle (DMSO) alone were used as negative controls for rotenone treatment

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Quantitative data are expressed as mean ± SEM, and statistical significance for all the quantitative data obtained was analyzed using the Student's t test (*p < 0.05, **p < 0.001)

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: For climbing ability: climbing score similar to age - matched normal control flies

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: For climbing ability: climbing score significantly lower than age - matched normal control flies (e.g., < 10% success for G2019S and Y1699C - expressing flies). For rotenone - induced DA neurodegeneration: significant loss of DA neurons compared to control flies
